cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi ESE of Cayo Largo, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across Cuba today, then turning north-northwest toward the eastern Gulf, skirting the west coast of Florida Tuesday–Wednesday, and recurving northeast along the U.S. Southeast/Mid-Atlantic coast late week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west coast of Florida near the Big Bend/Cedar Key area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Florida Keys, Florida Bay and west coast of Florida from Englewood to the Aucilla River
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Keys from Craig Key to Dry Tortugas and west coast of Florida from Flamingo to Englewood (Tropical Storm Warning); Cuban provinces of Cienfuegos and Matanzas (Hurricane Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. East Coast from Florida Keys northward through the Carolinas, Mid-Atlantic, and New England
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (<5%) of tropical-storm-force winds; gusts 25–35 mph possible Friday
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Friday into Saturday with localized heavier pockets
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated brief tornadoes and minor river rises could accompany rain bands
